verses.verse: "Behold,<WH2005> my eye<WH5869> has seen<WH7200> all<WH3605> [this,] My ear<WH241> has heard<WH8085> and understood<WH995> it.
"What<WH1847> you know<WH3045> I also<WH1571> know.<WH1847> I am not inferior<WH5307> to you.
"But I would speak<WH1696> to the Almighty,<WH7706> And I desire<WH2654> to argue<WH3198> with God.<WH410>
"But you smear<WH2950> with lies;<WH8267> You are all<WH3605> worthless<WH457> physicians.<WH7495>
"O<WH4310> that you would be completely<WH2790> silent,<WH2790> And that it would become<WH1961> your wisdom!<WH2451>
"Please<WH4994> hear<WH8085> my argument,<WH9640> And listen<WH7181> to the contentions<WH7379> of my lips.<WH8193>
"Will you speak<WH1696> what<WH9390> is unjust<WH9390> for God,<WH410> And speak<WH1696> what<WH7423> is deceitful<WH7423> for Him?
"Will you show<WH5375> partiality<WH6440> <WH5375> for Him? Will you contend<WH7378> for God<WH410>?
"Will it be well<WH2896> when<WH3588> He examines<WH2713> you? Or<WH518> will you deceive<WH8524> Him as one deceives<WH8524> a man<WH582>?
"He will surely<WH3198> reprove<WH3198> you, If<WH518> you secretly<WH5643> show<WH5375> partiality.<WH6440> <WH5375>
"Will not His majesty<WH7613> terrify<WH1204> you, And the dread<WH6343> of Him fall<WH5307> on you?
"Your memorable<WH2146> sayings<WH2146> are proverbs<WH4912> of ashes,<WH665> Your defenses<WH1354> are defenses<WH1354> of clay.<WH2563>
"Be silent<WH2790> before<WH4480> me so that I may speak;<WH1696> Then let come<WH5674> on me what<WH4100> may.
"Why<WH5921> <WH4100> should I take<WH5375> my flesh<WH1320> in my teeth,<WH8127> And put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in my hands<WH3709>?
"Though<WH2005> He slay<WH6991> me, I will hope<WH3176> in Him. Nevertheless<WH389> I will argue<WH3198> my ways<WH1870> before<WH413> <WH6440> Him.
"This<WH1931> also<WH1571> will be my salvation,<WH3444> For a godless<WH2611> man<WH2611> may not come<WH935> before His presence.<WH6440>
"Listen<WH8085> carefully<WH8085> to my speech,<WH4405> And let my declaration<WH262> [fill] your ears.<WH241>
"Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I have prepared<WH6186> my case;<WH4941> I know<WH3045> that I will be vindicated.<WH6663>
"Who<WH4310> will contend<WH7378> with me? For then<WH6258> I would be silent<WH2790> and die.<WH1478>
"Only<WH389> two<WH8147> things<WH8147> do not do<WH6213> to me, Then<WH227> I will not hide<WH5641> from Thy face: <WH6440>
Remove<WH7368> Thy hand<WH3709> from me, And let not the dread<WH367> of Thee terrify<WH1204> me.
"Then call,<WH7121> and I will answer;<WH6030> Or<WH176> let me speak,<WH1696> then reply<WH7725> to me.
"How<WH4100> many<WH4100> are my iniquities<WH5771> and sins<WH9128>? Make<WH3045> known<WH3045> to me my rebellion<WH6588> and my sin.<WH9128>
"Why<WH4100> dost Thou hide<WH5641> Thy face,<WH6440> And consider<WH2803> me Thine enemy<WH340>?
"Wilt Thou cause<WH6206> a driven<WH5086> leaf<WH5929> to tremble<WH6206>? Or wilt Thou pursue<WH7291> the dry<WH3002> chaff<WH7179>?
"For Thou dost write<WH3789> bitter<WH4846> things<WH4846> against<WH5921> me, And dost make me to inherit<WH3423> the iniquities<WH5771> of my youth.<WH5271>
"Thou dost put<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> in the stocks,<WH5465> And dost watch<WH8104> all<WH3605> my paths;<WH734> Thou dost set<WH2707> a limit<WH2707> for the soles<WH8328> of my feet,<WH7272>
While I am decaying<WH1086> like a rotten<WH7538> thing,<WH7538> Like a garment<WH899> that is moth-eaten.
